name: market for adiponitrile | adiponitrile | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25448/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for adiponitrile in the European geography. Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;Adiponitrile is an organic substance with the CAS no.: 000111-69-3. It is called 'hexanedinitrile' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: C6H8N2. It is liquid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure as a colorless oily liquid with no distinct odor. It is modelled as a pure substance. There are no publicly available information about the consumption of this substance on a consumer level. On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: chemicals (use as an intermediate mainly for nylon 6.6).

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce adiponitrile within the geography of RER.

This activity ends with the supply of adiponitrile  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
